text: Andrew Lamar Alexander, Jr. (born July 3, 1940) is an American politician. He was a United States senator from Tennessee from 2003 to 2021. He is a member of the Republican Party. Alexander was conference chair of the Republican Party in the US Senate from 2007 to 2012. He unsuccessfully ran for the Republican presidential nomination in 1996 and 2000. In December 2018, Alexander announced his retirement from the Senate by not running in the 2020 election.U.S. Senator Lamar Alexander Announces Retirement ==References== ==Other websites== *Senator Lamar Alexander official US Senate site *Lamar Alexander for Senate *Profile at SourceWatch Category:1940 births Category:Living people Category:1996 United States presidential candidates Category:2000 United States presidential candidates Category:New York University alumni Category:Governors of Tennessee Category:United States Secretaries of Education Category:United States senators from Tennessee Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:American Presbyterians Category:Academics from Tennessee Category:Lawyers from Tennessee
title: Lamar Alexander
